data.fullName: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park
data.description: For over a century people from around the world have come to rural Central Kentucky to honor the humble beginnings of our 16th president, Abraham Lincoln. His early life on Kentucky's frontier shaped his character and prepared him to lead the nation through Civil War. Visit our country's first memorial to Lincoln, built with donations from young and old, and the site of his childhood home.

entranceFees.description: There is no fee associated with visiting either unit of the park.
entranceFees.title: Fee Free Park

data.directionsInfo: The Birthplace Unit of the park is located approximately 2 miles south of the town of Hodgenville on U.S. Highway 31E South. The Boyhood Home Unit at Knob Creek is located approximately 10 miles northeast of the Birthplace Unit of the park.

operatingHours.description:
Memorial Building:
open 9:00 am - 4:30 pm eastern time.

Birthplace Unit Visitor Center and Grounds: 
open 9:00 am - 5:00 pm eastern time.
operatingHours.name: Birthplace Unit

exceptions.name: Spring Hours - Visitor Center at Knob Creek
Fall Hours - Knob Creek Visitor Center

operatingHours.description:
The Boyhood Home Unit at Knob Creek Grounds:
open daily dawn to dusk.

Knob Creek Tavern Visitor Center:
open on weekends in April, May, September and October and 5 days a week from Memorial Day to Labor day from 10 am to 4pm (Thursday - Monday) closed for the winter.
operatingHours.name: Boyhood Unit

images.title: The Memorial Building with fall colors
images.altText: The Memorial Building surrounded by fall colors
images.caption: Over 200,000 people a year come to walk up the steps of the Memorial Building to visit the site where Abraham Lincoln was born

images.title: The Memorial Building
images.altText: The first memorial erected to honor Abraham Lincoln
images.caption: The Memorial Building constructed on the traditional site of the birth of Abraham Lincoln.

images.title: The Symbolic Birth Cabin of Abraham Lincoln
images.altText: The symbolic birth cabin on the traditional site of the birth of Abraham Lincoln.
images.caption: The symbolic birth cabin of Abraham Lincoln.

images.title: Statue of the Lincoln Family in the Visitor Center
images.altText: Statue of the Lincoln family in the park's Visitor Center
images.caption: Visitors to the park can view the statue of the Lincoln family.

data.weatherInfo: There are four distinct seasons in Central Kentucky. However, temperature and weather conditions can vary widely within those seasons. Spring and Fall are generally pleasant with frequent rain showers. Summer is usually hot and humid. Winter is moderately cold with mixed precipitation.
data.name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace

data.description: 23,000 soldiers were killed, wounded or missing after twelve hours of savage combat on September 17, 1862. The Battle of Antietam ended the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia's first invasion into the North and led Abraham Lincoln to issue the preliminary Emancipation Proclamation.

entranceFees.description: 3 day pass - This is the entry fee to the battlefield proper, museum, movie, and ranger programs.
entranceFees.title: Antietam National Battlefield Entrance Fee

entranceFees.description: 3 day vehicle pass.  This pass covers everyone in a vehicle, ie. family.  The pass covers entry to the battlefield proper, museum, movie, and ranger programs.
entranceFees.title: Antietam National Battlefield Entrance Fee

entranceFees.description:
•$100 Motor Coach/Commercial Tour Groups with 26 or more people

•$40 per passenger bus with 7-25 people

•$25 per passenger bus with 1-6 people

Bus drivers (1 per vehicle) FREE

Step on guides can be hired through our bookstore, which is operated by Eastern National. Please call (301)432-4329 to schedule a guide.
entranceFees.title: Group Entrance Fees

entrancePasses.description: Interagency Lifetime Senior Pass:  $80 Lifetime.  This is a pass for U.S. Citizens or permanent residents, age 62 or over. This pass provides access to, and the use of Federal recreation sites that charge an Entrance or Standard Amenity Fee*. This pass admits the pass holder and passengers in a non-commercial vehicle at per vehicle areas and pass holder plus 3 adults at per person fee areas.
entrancePasses.title: Interagency Lifetime Senior Pass

entrancePasses.description: Interagency Access Pass:  Valid for life. This is a lifetime pass for U.S. Citizens or permanent resident with permanent disabilities. Documentation is required to obtain the pass. This pass provides access to, and use of Federal recreation sites that charge an entrance fee.
entrancePasses.title: Interagency Access Pass

entrancePasses.description: Valid for one year from month of purchase for Antietam National Battlefield only. Admits pass holder and passengers in a single private vehicle.
entrancePasses.title: Antietam National Battlefield Annual Pass

entrancePasses.description: This is a free pass to active duty military personal and their dependents. In order to qualify for the pass, the military member must present a valid Department of Defense, CAC Card. Dependents must present a valid Department of Defense ID (DD Form 1173) that identifies the dependent and his or her sponsor. Some members of the Military Reserve might not be eligible.
entrancePasses.title: Interagency Military Pass

entrancePasses.description: Interagency Annual Senior Pass:  $20 Annually.  This is a pass for U.S. Citizens or permanent residents, age 62 or over. This pass provides access to, and the use of Federal recreation sites that charge an Entrance or Standard Amenity Fee*. This pass admits the pass holder and passengers in a non-commercial vehicle at per vehicle areas and pass holder plus 3 adults at per person fee areas.
entrancePasses.title: Interagency Annual Senior Pass

entrancePasses.description: Fourth grade students and their families can benefit from free admission to fee-collecting parks, public lands and waters by downloading a paper pass from the Every Kid Outdoors website. In addition, if the 4th grader would like to exchange the paper passes for a more durable "keepsake" Fourth Grade Annual Pass, they may do so at the park's visitor center from 9:00 to 4:00 daily.
entrancePasses.title: 4th Grade Student Pass

data.directionsInfo: Ten miles south of I-70 on Maryland Route 65

operatingHours.description: The visitor center is open every day except Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's Day.
operatingHours.name: Antietam National Battlefield Visitor Center

images.title: Monument at Sunset
images.altText: a monument of a soldier at sunset
images.caption: 130th Pennsylvania Monument at Bloody Lane

images.title: Cannon the Field
images.altText: artillery piece sitting on a rock break
images.caption: Artillery played a key role at Antietam.  Over 500 cannon were involved in the fighting.

images.title: Dunker Church

images.caption: The Dunker Church covered in snow.

images.title: Burnside Bridge
images.caption: Burnside Bridge from the Confederate side of Antietam Creek.

images.title: Fog Over the Battlefield
images.altText: fog filling in the low areas of the field at sunset
images.caption: View from the visitor center looking toward Bloody Lane at sunset

images.title: Antietam National Cemetery Lodge Building

images.caption: The National Cemetery Lodge Building sits just inside the gates of the cemetery.

images.title: Dunker Church
images.altText: small white building with cannon in the foreground
images.caption: Spring at the Battlefield.

data.weatherInfo: The weather is fairly mild. Summers can be very warm and humid and winters cold and snowy. We have four distinct seasons with the fall and spring being the best times to visit the battlefield.
data.name: Antietam
